snippet: A federal judge found that an exam for New York teaching candidates was discriminatory because it did not measure skills necessary to do the job.
abstract: Federal Judge Kimba M Wood rules that Liberal Arts and Sciences Test administered from 2004 to 2012 to assess New York teaching candidates was racially discriminatory; finds that Evaluation Systems, which made test under name National Evaluation Systems, went about process in backwards manner.
lead_paragraph: A federal judge found that an exam for New York teaching candidates was discriminatory because it did not measure skills necessary to do the job.

headline.main: Judge Rules Second Version of New York Teachers’ Exam Is Also Racially Biased
headline.print_headline: Judge Rules 2nd Version of Teachers’ Exam Is Also Racially Biased
